Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: KAM0310
Reviews.Content: Property was nice. Location is great. We had to switch rooms as our original one assigned had a moldy shower and the whole unit wasn't very clean. The next unit was a little better but not great. I have stayed at Wyndham properties with timeshare owners and the units have been great. I was told by the front desk staff that when you make a reservation as a paying customer and not an "owner", you are not guaranteed a room type, i.e. one king or two doubles. Also, the rooms they offer paying customers are actually owned by private owners and "rented" out to paying customers like we were. My kids had a great time and the Ocean Walk restaurants were good. Melanie and Joe, the bartenders at the Landing Bar were awesome! Sadly though, due to the lack of room quality, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was Terrible”
Reviews.Author: beachgoer011
Reviews.Content: I paid around 160.00 per night and stayed 2 nights with my 2 young kids and husband. When I first checked in I got the wrong room, and they said they had no more of the room that I had reservered. I used the pull out bed for my kids and the mattress was gross. They only had sheets in the room. I went all the way down the elevator with my 2 kids to ask for some blankets and pillows and they told me no. We had no one come to take our trash of give us clean towels. I will never go back....

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE PRICE PAID POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: 3125HARLEY
Reviews.Content: We booked our spring break vacation at the Wyndham Oceanwalk by calling the number on the website. The 2 bedroom lockout we booked was described as having a fully equipped kitchen but this wasn't the case - we had no cups/ glasses for drinks only 2 wine glasses for 4 people, the four plates were chipped or broke. The room detail also said a leather sofa. The sofa was cloth it was faded and had tears all over. We did have a coffee maker but no coffee so we asked the front desk if we could get a packet of coffee for the next morning, they called management and we were told we couldn't have any because our room was privately owned. The shower has mold and the balcony chairs were so rusted you couldn't use them, used dining table chair to watch sunrise. The furnishings were old and worn out, We talked with management and showed them the poor conditions and they told us since it was privately owned they couldn't help us that it was the owners responsibility.They told us the other 2 bedroom units are beautiful, nothing like ours. We just wanted a nice room for our stay. It shouldn't matter who owns the room the WYNDHAM name is still on the building and CUSTOMER SATIFACTION should be a priority. Never did get any glasses or a break on the room cost. Do Not book room 1704 oceanfront it's not worth $300 a night. Check your room before checking in. Make sure it's worth the money.We learned the hard way

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: mcwill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Walk March 26-31. Last year we stayed at a different resort but had friends that were staying at Ocean Walk and visited them so we knew what to expect. Actually there was a pleasant surprise. We were hesitant to stay there because last year the pools were FREEZING (had nothing to do with the weather because the pool at our resort was great) and it took our 6yo a while to get in. During our stay the pools were fine, could have been a little warmer but swimmable. The resort is great because you can walk to things if you want (great location) and you really don't have to leave unless you want. pools were clean enough although the toddler pool could have been a little cleaner. Check in/ check out was no problem, although we were doing it at days/times that weren't real busy. I did see a lot of people in line at busy times. The "market" was great for breakfast and the drinks at the pool bar, while pricey, are very good. The only real negative I have about this resort would be service, but not with the people. I think a resort should make it as easy as possible for people to "do things". Example: we need a dolly to take the groceries up to the 19th floor. I have to go all the was to the "sun center" (or whatever it is called), leave my ID, go out to the car, get my stuff, go to the room, go all the back to the place to return the dolly. Its not a big deal but put them in a central location so people don't have to "work" to do things. All in all a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: robinwnt
Reviews.Content: They should do something with the lazy river looks very green. Pools were very clean and plenty of them. Also no internet in the rooms you have to go to the lobby to connect.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: me12Mi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Wyndham Ocean Walk.We had a great time. We have stayed there quite a few times and have never had a complaint, The only complaints we had this time was that the pool bar closed before 5:00 just when everyone was coming up from the beach & wanted to enjoy a drink around the pool. and the lazy river pool was green & needed to be cleaned. No one was using it because it looked gross

Reviews.Title: “First Timer!!!”
Reviews.Author: mom_on_vacation_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Daytona and boy I was really pleased! The Ocean Walk Cond-Resort is a perfect place to stay for a family with kids or teenagers. We have always gone to Panama but with the weather being so cold we moved East for Spring Break. Our 2 bdr condo reservations were made at the last minute (thurs. nite arrived on Sat) When we called the hotel they told us that they did not have any more rooms on the ocean front. We did not want to go on vacation and not have an oceanfront view so we checked out the www.VRBO.com web site and put in our arrival info. and Bingo! 2 Bdrm suite oceanfront rooms were avaialble. We called the owner up and booked the room. Very easy! Room was VERY nice with 2 bdrm, 2 baths, 2 kitchens, 2 living rooms, 2 sets of washer and dryer, and 4 nice size tvs. and yes jacuzzi tub in the room as well. We stayed on the 23 floor and did not have any throubles with the elevators at all. They had 4 working elevators in the north tower and we never had to wait long at all. We had 4 teenager and 1 child plus 2 adults and the room slept up to 11 people very nicely. The water pressure was perfect in the showers and I couldn't believe that we NEVER ran out of hot water. All of the showers and tub's drained very well. The decor in our room was perfect. They do differ from owner to owner. The hotel comes with 2 outdoor heated pools which the water was very comfortable for the kids....even at nite. There are 3 hot tubs outside that were really a nice size and they were cleaned every morning. The lazy river was full of kids but it is not heated. There is a bar/restaurant on the pool deck that is also very convenient. The only bad thing about the pool area is the sun is blocked off about 2:30 p.m. every day because of the resort towers. We spent all of our time on the beach which by the way is a "no driving car zone" beach. Loved that!!! I really loved the food trailers that they have on the beach which makes it very convenient to grab some awsome onion rings, chili chese fris, etc.! These food trailers also rent bikes, tricycles, boogie boards, lawnchairs, etc. at a very cheap rate. Kids loved that!! Right outside our resort is Ocean Walk shops. This was sooooo awsome because the kids could walk there by themselves and there was so much to do and see. Movie 10 theater, beach shops, ice cream, awsome restaurants...all right outside our condo. Our favorite rest. was Sloppy Joe's...wonderful atmosphere and great food. Our hotel also provided activities at night for the kids...they had movie night at the pool, and karoke ! There is even a blockbuster down in the activities area to rent movies for our rainy day!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: AdamsFamTrips
Reviews.Content: Quality amenities and good service. Great view of ocean, beach and pier.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: HartleyIA
Reviews.Content: The location of this resort is perfect. Set on the beautiful beach front. There is a lot to do within walking distance. Shops, places to eat, movies, ect. We found the employees to be friendly and helpful. We had a 1 bedroom unit facing the street. The view did not bother us but the hallway right outside your bedroom window did. You could hear every step and voice. It made it tough for the little ones to go to sleep. You could also hear anything said in the adjoining unit as only a door with a 1 inch gap at the bottom to divide. I would request a beach front room and/or the whole 2 bedroom unit the next time. The minikitchen/living/dining was one of the smallest we have experienced. The bedroom was a good size. Very, very nice pool area with slide and lazy river. Over all we enjoyed our stay and I would recommend resort.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: 01RoadKingRider
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks stay at this resort for Bike Week 2010. We arrived on Saturday, Feb 27th and departed on Saturday, March 6th. I had read several negative reviews on this site regarding the hotel and was very hesitant to stay at this location but decided to do so because of the proximity to Main Street and the beach. I can't say enouhg nice things about this property. I rented a condo from an owner and was extremely pleased with the property. The staff was friendly and courteous and the rooms were spotless. We were given an adequate supply of laundry detergent and dish washer detergent. The linens were clean and fresh. The bedding appeared to be top of the line and was very comfortable. Even with the large number of people in the hotel we had no trouble with the elevators. The rooms were safe and no deficiencies were noted with the security. The patio door lock worked well and the room safe was in great repair. I am already making plans to go back to this property for Biketoberfest in October. I would recommend this property with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: dranke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 nights in February 2010 as well as February 2008. This place is THE BEST! This time we had a 2 bedroom condo. There were a couple of issues when we checked in (balcony door broken, a light out in bathroom) but both were fixed within an hour. We had a king size bed with master bath. The bathroom was huge and included a large jacuzzi tub. The kitchen had pretty much everything you needed for cooking. We made a quick trip to Publix about 2 miles north & we were set for a few days. The 2nd bedroom & bath were very nice and our 3 grown children enjoyed their stay. Washer & dryer included in the unit was very helpful, especially with pool towels & swimsuits. Even though it was cool most of the time we were in Florida, we used the pools & hot tubs almost every day. All are excellent. The staff here is helpful and everything is well maintained. The gym was well equipped and they even have several types of exercise classes daily (zumba, water aerobics, etc). One problem is they don't have internet access in the rooms. You have to lug your computer down to the lobby area. We were told they were going to upgrade this sometime in the future. The hotel is in close proximity to Main Street attractions & International Speedway Boulevard. There are several restaurants, bars & souvineer shops closeby as well. The Ocean Walk Shoppes mall is attached. All in all, we love this place and will definitely come back again next year. I highly recommend the Ocean Walk!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JWilCincinnati_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Ocean Walk was a very nice place to stay in Daytona Beach, FL. The staff was polite and our room was beautiful and clean. This room looked like it was just updated. It had 2 new TV's, new kitchen, new whirlpool tub, glass door shower, balcony, stove and microwave. The colors were yellow and blue and the furniture was great. The location was nice. Stop at level 4 on the south tower and you can get off to enter a new walk area to Starbucks, a Movie Theater, Restaurants and various stores. The beach was located near a pier and was clean. Also a little sandwich truck was on the beach and this made it easy to get a drink or hamburger.There were 2 outdoor pools, a lazy river, 2 or 3 hot tubs, 2 indoor pools. We also went to the computer room, game room, hotel's restaurant and the gym. The had alot things to do if you wanted-like crafts, yoga, trips etc. We loved all the amenities and the location the best. The last two days of our stay was the start of Bike Week and we did hear the "zoom,zoom" noise, but it wasn't too bad. Kids would love this place because they have a great pool slide.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Melissalynn19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very enjoyable. All the amenities and right on the beach. Very comfortable suites and a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “In Need Of Repair”
Reviews.Author: timefliesPortland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel in unit 1105 and were extremely disappointed in the quality of the room. It looked like it was WELL used. There were huge stains on the carpet and bar stools. The bathroom cupboard was barely hanging and the wall had only an empty metal bracket instead of a towel holder. The wall paper border in the bedroom was falling off in several places. The sliding glass door handle was broken off! The furniture looked as though it was just picked up from the Goodwill. The 2 beds in the bedroom were so small, just barely bigger than a twin size. I had booked this trip a year in advance as a surprise Daytona 500 trip for my husband. I was deeply disappointed for the amount of money I paid for the package to be put up in such a dingy hotel. The one thing I will say is the view from the balcony was beautiful and the pools looked nice except that it was freezing cold so we were unable to use them. There is no restaurant, there is a store that you can order some breakfast items from that tasted ok. When we asked about changing rooms the hotel staff told us they didn't have anything else and were unapologetic in any manner. Housekeeping came 1 of the 3 days we were there and emptied garbage cans and left towels, that's about it. There was hair all over the floor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: frankzouf
Reviews.Content: loved it but we stayed in room 2424a. here we go when we got there we could not find simple things in are room like are room keys and stuped things like that then you would go back and look again and it would be right in front of you spooky this happend alot a few times a day we got a crazy photo where it looks like someone with a mean face is looking at us in the back round and my wife and kid thought it was odd that we kept losing stuff then we would find it so my kid looked on the internet and found out that a 16 year old boy fell from the 24th floor 3 rooms over from where are room was crazy i thought it was funny until i saw that on the internet it was like someone was in the room with you im not joking i am 6 feet 300 lbs not much gets me scared like that had to write this as soon as i got back stayed in disneyworld after and nothing went missing but i would stay at this resort again just not on the 24th floor lol if anyone had a similer experience please write a review this resort is awesome i will be there again in oct

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could have been there longer!”
Reviews.Author: Michielyn
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Wyndham in Daytona after spending a week in Orlando. It was very laid back, and relaxing... even with all the people. I wish we would have spent more time. We stayed on the Trendwest floor. I don't remember which one it was, but we borrowed someone's timeshare. They booked us a deluxe 2 bedroom, as with Trendwest all these face the ocean. Considering, we had an INCREDIBLE view. The master bedroom had a jacuzzi tub in a nice size bathrom. The room was stocked in typical timeshare fashion. We had everything we needed. There is a Publix not far down the road (which has many small portion sizes). The hotel had a towel checkout limit, and you couldn't exchange. However, our room did have a washer dryer. The hotel is connected to a little shopping center with a few stores and food places and a Starbucks. Of course, it's also right on the beach. Although if you prefer there is a pool and a lazy river. I thought everything was kept clean and in good order. Although, I did read some complaints. I was happy! I thought it was beautiful. Onedownside was lack of inroom wifi. I went down to the lobby and joined all the PJ wearing people later in the evening. Another was our bathroom REEKED of smoke every so often. The Trendwest floor is no smoking....BUT the floors under are not. We were able to control it though, and it didn't ruin our trip. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay, but don't expect much more”
Reviews.Author: Scott-VT99
Reviews.Content: Spent four weekdays here while attending a conference at the Hilton next door (the Hilton was sold out). Booking was a little confusing, as I didn't fully realize that I was essentially renting someone's timeshare. Whatever, I'm not picky that way. Picked out a one-bedroom deluxe oceanfront. Arrived around 8:30 PM, no problems checking in. Go up to my room, it's as advertised, looks very nice, clean, beautiful ocean view. Then I step onto the carpet. It squishes under my feet. Investigate further, water is on the tile floor by the toilet and the carpet where it meets the tile is soaked. Determine it's clean water, decide to leave well enough alone. By the next evening it's dry. Layout of the room is nice, everything was clean, kitchen was very well provisioned (I could have made waffles!), beautiful whirlpool tub and big shower. Even had packets of laundry detergent to use in the washer and dryer. Absolutely no complaints except for the standing water. Only other odd thing was that every window and the sliding glass door were all unlocked. The strike plate for the door was also loose. Fixed those things myself. I'm an engineer; I couldn't leave it like that... Go get my "Welcome Packet" the next evening and learn it's a marketing ploy to get you to listen to a timeshare sales pitch. Fortunately I'm busy all day every day and the nice lady behind the counter was not pushy. At this point I learn that the only food available here is vending machines or the glorified convenience store that is only open in the morning and early afternoon. Good thing the Ocean Walk Village is right next door. Come back to the room, flip open my laptop, start looking for Internet access. No joy. Only place it's available is in the lobby, but I could sit anywhere and it was free, just like the parking. Even though it was only about 50 degrees Fahrenheit outside the next morning, the outdoor pool was like a bathtub. Lazy river, etc. was all in working order. Wonderful! There was always a security guard out front and usually in the pool area. I never felt unsafe, even when walking back late at night. That may have been because the oceanfront was completely dead due to cold weather, etc. On the last day, I needed to store my suitcase while I attended the conference. It took an inordinate amount of time to locate a bellman to put my bag in the "closet." When he did finally show up, he did not have any claim tickets with him and just handed me a piece of paper with a couple of details as my "ticket." As a result of all this I was ten minutes late to the meeting. Go back to pick it up, again, no bellman, walk back with the maintenance guy to get my back from the "closet." It was an unused meeting room at the back corner of the hotel. It was not locked. This whole process took nearly 20 minutes. Ended up scrambling to make my return flight. Fortunately I only had to go back to DAB and not MCO. So, long story short, it's a beautiful hotel with a nice swimming area, but not much else. It is a great location, though. If I need to go back to Daytona, I will definitely price out staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach - NASCAR expierience”
Reviews.Author: Athens_GABeachDawg
Reviews.Content: Visited Daytona Beach for the first time in a few years. They have dressed it up a bit since our last visit. Took the time to visit the Daytona 500 expierience and that was really cool - actually convinced us to come back for the 500 race. We stayed at the Wyndham Ocean Walk and had a fabulous time. We had a 2 bedroom condo and what a difference from staying in a little hotel room. They also had 4 pools and tons of stuff for the kids to do. We found an owner - Vicki - who rents out owners rooms there and we booked our stay for the 500 thru her - you can find her at DaytonaBeachRents dot com. Tell her Lee said to call.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities, lots of family activities and fun for kids”
Reviews.Author: paenca
Reviews.Content: Our family of three generations spent a week in a North Tower oceanfront 3-bedroom unit in mid December. It was a slow week at the resort so it was quite nice and relaxing and at times that provided us a sense of exclusivity. We did extensive research beforehand, ruling out two others (St Maarten and the higher end Ocean Vista) and eventually chose Ocean Walk for its convenient location, abundant facilities/activities including indoor pools which were important for us given the time of year. We were overall quite pleased with our stay as the kids had tons of fun with the pools and mini golf, and participated in daily activities (although some charges for the activities appeared a bit high) and the adults thoroughly enjoyed the nice roomy hot spas and the reasonably equipped gym. As others mentioned the choice of booking was confusing. We were quoted (four months before our intended stay) $1,800 by a resort rep who tried to convince us that there was only one unit left and we had to reserve that day to keep it (yeah right!) We also searched various vacation rental sites and found individual owned lock-out units which were going for around $1,200; We then discovered brokered 3-brm timeshare units on auction sites for as low as $500. As we were not interested in the high pressure sales or the high price provided from the resort, or a lock-out unit (apparently the only way to get a real North Tower 3-brm unit is either through the resort or from timeshares), we called up a couple of the brokers and were assured that their other customers had been quite happy with the quality of the rooms. They were right and we are so happy that we got a wonderful stay at a great bargain. My advice to anyone considering Ocean Walk is to do your homework and understand what you are looking for and what the resort can offer. Ocean Walk is a largely timeshare owned resort and not a high-end first-class hotel. Some of the negatives we noted were - lack of internet in the rooms (it was available in the lobby/bar/restaurant area and we were told that it will be available in the guest rooms starting Jan 2010); three of the four treadmills did not work although we were the only ones at the gym. minor stains on couches; the windows of the two smaller bedrooms face the hallway so did not have any views; the balcony does not extend ourside the master bedroom and is partially open to next door neighbor (we believe it is intended so that the views are not blocked though it does raise security concern); and for whatever reason the master bedroom window is designed to not be openable. However given that we had read most of these issues and had our expectations well adjusted and that the price we paid is unbeatable, we were quite happy with our choice. The kids did not want to leave in the end and claimed Ocean Walk was their most favorite accomodation during our three-week holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations and view!”
Reviews.Author: ms2me
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom delux condo was amazing. We had an oceanfront unit and we able to watch the New Year's Eve fireworks from our balcony. This is a great place to stay. It is vacation-have fun and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel with Lots of Activities”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMindy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Daytona Beach and we stayed at the Wyndham Ocean Walk. I investigated the Wyndham and found such mixed reviews that I really hesitated in making a reservation. I looked at a lot of different options and found I could rent directly from the Wyndham, rent a room on eBay, or rent from an owner. I decided to find a room I liked and rent directly from a local owner so I knew what floor I was on and what the unit looked like and also had someone nearby if there were problems. We were SO happy with the room and would go that route again in the future. It was decorated beautifully, had new bedding and was very comfortable (we were on the 6th floor in the South Tower which was nice - we parked in the garage right outside our room). The people we rented from were incredibly nice and helpful. I was really concerned that we'd be pressured into timeshare sales since this is a timeshare location. We were not once even asked about timeshare sales. No phone calls, no literature, nothing. I also read that there were problems with elevators and that concerned me, but we had no issues at all. We have two children (1 and 4) and they had a ton of activities to do. It was FREEZING in Daytona this past week but there was still plenty to keep the kids busy. We went swimming at the indoor pools, the kids did some of their activities (which there were plenty to choose from), and we did the mini golf. I recommend staying at this hotel and will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: IndianaFitz61
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience. Check-in was a breeze. Our 2 bedroom condo was in great condition and very roomy. The only thing wrong was TV remote in the MB was missing the batteries, but maintence switched out the remote almost as soon we called. We were on the 12th floor with a view of the ocean. The kids loved playing in the pool and playing miniature golf. The weather was a bit chilly so we used the indoor pool the most. We did venture out to the outdoor pools but since the pool heater was broke we did not spend too much time there. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Only one seemed a bit mean-spirited, but maybe she was having an off day.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the homepage”
Reviews.Author: luvn2goaway
Reviews.Content: This resort is FAR from upscale. Don't be fooled by the advertisements/photos. Service from staff is minimal; the only attention you get is from the timeshare people constantly harrassing you. The kids club was ok - everything is additinal $ to do. The arcade is horrible. Small, nothing works & forget trying to get help to get your coins back. You feel claustrophic in the hotel. We had an ocean front - so we received natural light. The other room we also had you felt ike you were in a fishbowl - your window opens up to hallway, so for privacy you need to keep your shade closed - resulting in no natural light. There is one bank of elevators (with only 1 working) and walking the long hallway is becomes annoying each day. The real downer was the lack of sun!!! The hotel is so tall it BLOCKS the sun from the pool/patio area. So by 1:00 it is total SHADE. You can go to the beach but you have to constantly move your chair to stay inthe sun. Annoying. 1 of the 2 pools heated pools was only slightly heated - very dissapppointing. We went in November - so it was a bit chilly - but with the lack of proper heating inthe pool and the shade by noon over the pool - we/kids did not use the pools as much as we hoped. BEWARE - at exactly 10:00 on check-out day your keys are automatically voided. We were locked out of our room at 10:06 and had to wait for security to let us back in to retrieve our remaining luggage. Withthe 2 towers (north & south) is a pain to go down 1 set of elavators walk through lobby to other side to go to other set of elevators. The shops? Everything is closed down/empty retail space inthe ocean walk shops. We do NOT recommend Oceanwalk Wyndham at all.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best places we have stayed”
Reviews.Author: lototrav
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have stayed here this year.I find it very hard to believe the bad reviews this place has gotten.we had a ocean front room both times. the room was very clean the people that work there went out of there way to please us.there was plentry of things to do. the pool water was very clean .no bugs there were guards around the pool area I would recomend this hotel to anyone. lots of things for the kids too.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: gregs238
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2x this year..both times was GREAT.. the 2bedroom lock out is A LOT better than the 2bedroom, but both are nice...There is not a lot to do in daytona so the Ocean walk has some thing going on every other hr...the kids loved it!! Look around for good deals. $200-$250 a night is kinda high for fall/winter. I will be going back with the family again and again

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY”
Reviews.Author: Princesskain
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Wyndham Ocean Walk. It was the most amazing and relaxing vacation that either of us have had. We had an ocean view room on the 24th floor of the North Tower. The views were incredible. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. The jacuzzi tub was an added bonus. The large stand up shower was relaxing. Everything about the room was great, the only thing we wished we had was opening windows in the bedroom so we could hear the ocean better at night. The central air was very efficient. Full kitchen ammenities and the washer/dryer were great to have. The hotel itself is a self contained community with every ammenity at your fingers. The basement floor has a inground pool, yoga studio, fitness center, childrens play center, billiards game room, computer center and more. There is a miniature golf course on the 4th floor. Ground level has a inground pool, eatery and bar. Outdoor pool area was incredible! Every morning we floated around the lazy river for awhile and then jumped in the pools and took great advantage of the water slide. I especially appreciated that the pools are 6ft deep in parts .... I know that in Orlando you are lucky to find a pool that gets to 5ft deep! Oh, and I'd like to add that the outdoor pools were NOT overly chlorinated! Infact, it was the cleanest and least chlorinated pool I have ever swam in. The indoor pools however, though very warm and inviting, did sting your nose and eyes a bit. It is a 1 minute walk from the pool area to "OceanWalk", where there are a variety of eateries, shops and even a 3 story movie theater! (The theater was awesome, seats were very comfortable). Across the street is a water park and indoor fun park. The water park was to our dismay closed for the season during our stay. We loved this hotel and can't wait to go back! It was the most relaxing vacation ever .... from the comforts of the room, to the magnitude of activites within walking distance ... from the refreshing pools to swimming in the warm ocean and walks along the beach, from Starbucks every morning to Coldstone IceCream for afternoon dessert .... and sitting at the maitai bar under the tiki torches and watching electric storms over the ocean .... absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed at the Wyndham Ocean Walk Daytona Beach-Biketoberfest”
Reviews.Author: jarrd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on vacation at the Wyndham Ocean Walk Resort in Dayton on Atlantic Drive this past week of October 12-18th, for biketoberfest. The accommodations were lovely, clean and the staff was very professional at reception. Than a call came on Tuesday morning 10-13-09 at 4:30am that there had been an “incident” in the garage, both of our motorcycles and several others had been vandalized and burglarized, with items taken. My husband couldn’t go back to sleep so he used the Internet in the lobby (no wyfi in the rooms at this time). Upon his return I asked him if he had the camera, he said no, that is when we discovered not only our camera was missing, my husband’s medications, the extra camera battery, a $100 dollar gift certificate that was in the pocket of my husbands vest and a small knife were missing. We immediately called security that took an incident report. We had to contact the police on our own. That day was spent in the repair shop for our motorcycle, what a way to spend a vacation day! We are very disappointed in the lack of urgency with the security team; the motorcycles were not treated as priority. In all the years we have been visiting this resort during Biketoberfest and Bike Week, motorcycles have been secured in the lower levels, this year it was find your own space. After the break ins, the police drove about Tuesday & Wednesday, but bikes were never remanded to the lower levels. We complained about the lack of security precautions for our motorcycles to no avail. Motorcycles are more vulnerable to vandalism, and many twice the cost of a vehicle. On Wednesday my husband notice that a paper towel had been stuck into the door jam of our room, we did not alert security due to the lack of interest of our plight. We had been dismissed. Now during this whole week we had been finding Pizza flyers from the Pizzeria across the street, two or three a day. The day we got burglarized our neighbor had a flyer pushed half way under their door. I noticed it as we did not have one. During the week, flyers were everywhere, this was odd to me as, we were told we could order pizza but they are not allowed to deliver to the rooms, pizza had to be picked up in the lobby. So why all the flyers? The answer was easy, yesterday afternoon 10-17-09, my husband was walking down the hall to our room, and observed two young men with backpacks, flyers, pushing on doors as they walked. My husband called to them, asked them who they worked for, that they were not supposed to be here and they quickly left. As my husband turned into our hall he saw our neighbor’s door was standing open. My husband must have interrupted them. My husband knocked on the neighbor’s door to alert them (they were in the bathroom!), he explained we had been robbed; now we know how. My husband alerted security, and the comment was this ‘just doesn’t happen’ there was absolutely no interest! My husband went across the street and spoke with the manager regarding their staff handing out flyers. The manager stated they do not have staff or hire anyone to hand out flyers. Still resort security was uninterested. We will never feel safe at the Wyndham again and are extremely disappointed at the lack of security at this resort. We have been Worldmark owners since 1999.

Reviews.Title: “Nice play to stay only a few surprises.”
Reviews.Author: MomofTeensSC
Reviews.Content: We went on the trip for part business/part family trip. We went with our family of 4 plus 2 inlaws. The overall Resort was fabulous! Plenty of things to do at the resort, staff was pretty friendly and helpful and suite was very clean and nice. We only had a few surprises.... First when we booked the room we told the person that we would need 2 parking spaces. We were told it wasn't a problem the 1st space would be complimentary and the 2nd space was $10. What we didn't find out until we arrived was that only 1 of the 2 would be in the Wyndam Parking Garage. The 2nd space was across the street in the public parking garage. Not a huge deal, but a little aggravating when we all left to go somewhere. Then there was the luggage carts... if you want one, be prepared to give the attendant at the carts your driver's license. You won't get a cart unless you do. Again, not a big deal, but not too crazy about having to leave the license to get a cart. And finally, we did not know that they didn't have housekeeping come in unless you call and request (not a big deal though, I prefer people not running in and out of my room unless I'm there anyway). But we did find out after asking about getting additional clean towels that we had to wash the ones we had.(there was a stackable W/D in the suite). Again, not too big of a deal, but just wasn't informed. Pools could have used a vaccuum a little more but not bad. Overall it was a great place. Not complaining about these things just informing you of things we did not know at first. I did love the place. It was very well kept, staff was friendly, on site store and eating options. Just a few steps away is the Ocean Walk Shores Shoppes. There you find many different types of food, clothing, and a movie theater. Also there is the Bubba Gump Restaurant. There were plenty of pools on the property and security was seen constantly. I would stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: TNACgal
Reviews.Content: loved this resort, plenty of security on the beach and resort to keep you safe, love the amenties. great lounge and little snack bar, couple of pools, a small lazy river and water slide, with a kids water area, also shops, restuarants, movie theater and water park next door. can't drive on beach at resort but entrance only a few blocks away if you would like to do that I did not like the parking, but I guess limited space near beach. Looked like other parts of Daytona were hurting so not much open, but did not need to go far, everything pretty much right there at your resort. A little pricey, and everyone does not get a window, a balcony toward ocean is precious.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: SassyBritches
Reviews.Content: This place was connected to the movie theater mall & beside the band shell! It has 2 indoor & 2 outdoor pools. Also an inside putt putt golf course and a putting area in the middle of the lazy river. Inner Tubes are FREE and it is definately fun for all ages. There is a cool bar by the pool but it is not the place just to be quiet and listen to the ocean- Always music blasting! There is a fun slide for older kids and a entire little kids play area with sprinkler and pool. You must get a ocean front room! The master bdrm lacks a balcony but has a jacuzzi. The 2nd and 3rd bdrms windows face the outer hallway. The hallway stays lite 24/7. It only has blinds and it's never completely dark in the room. I was in the master but if I had to sleep a week in the other rooms it would annoy me- really silly design! My unit had a mold issue under the sink cabnets. You could not see it but smelled it strong when you opened the doors. Same smell in bathroom toilet room so I just left door shut at all times. I have allergies so it was bother some. There must have been a leak at some point but no visible problems now, just the lingering smell. The staff was ridiculouly friendly and helpful. Lots of things for the kids to do all day and a fair amount for adults as well. There is only free parking for 1 car and $10 fee for each addition. TV's are older and small and there is no internet in the unit but there is a business center and free wi-fi in the lobby. It had a stackable washer & dryer. Kitchen was nicely furnished, also had an icemaker & dish washer. My unit had a vacuum sweeper and the belt broke. The maintenance person was surprised that the sweeper was there and said it will be replaced with a Swifter for carpet. . With seven people & dark carpet the sweeper needed to be ran every second day and I definately would want a electric sweeper to pick up more than just surface dirt! You had to sign for beach towels & they had a $15 charge per towel if not returnrd. We ate Pizza at 3 differnt places- Napoli across the street was open late and was the Best!

Reviews.Title: “MY 14th FLOOR ROOM WAS BURGLARIZED & I LOST TOTAL ITEMS VALUED @ $2500.00 & THEIR INSURANCE REFUSED TO PAY!!”
Reviews.Author: daveas62
Reviews.Content: I am from Pennsylvania and recently stayed at the Wyndham Ocean Walk Resort in Daytona Beach Florida. This was my first time to Daytona Beach and an easy 20 years since I had a “real” getaway vacation. My girlfriend and I started off having a great time until our UPSCALE RESORT ROOM WAS BURGLARIZED. I would like to share my experience with you so you can make your own decision as to whether or not you want to risk having a similar experience yourself at this resort. We arrived at the Wyndham Ocean Walk Resort on September 1, 2009, around 4:00pm. We had no trouble checking in as some people have stated, however, it was only a Tuesday. We then began our vacation by enjoying the resort facilities, the beach, many local establishments, sightseeing, and of course the Daytona 500 Speedway Experience Tour…this was a BIG highlight of my vacation. So far I had taken about 500 pictures during the first 48 hours of our trip. On Thursday, September 3, 2009, we enjoyed a great meal and perfect service at the Outback Steakhouse. We returned to our room, #1406, around 8:30pm…. Keep in mind we were only gone for about 2 hours! Upon entering our room, I noticed the bathroom light was on (I turned “everything” off when we left). As I entered the bedroom I soon discovered my camera bag and equipment were missing (value of contents $2400.00)….. I further searched our room and noticed the balcony door looked slightly open… I grabbed the door and it opened right up. The lock was in the locked position, but due to a malfunctioning door, it did not catch the hook inside the door jam and allowed the door to be opened from the outside. Also stolen were prescription medication, cash, and our dresser drawers were gone through. The rooms on either side of us were not in use, so how could someone possibly enter a balcony door on the 14th floor? I immediately contacted the resort manager, security, and the Daytona Beach PD. A lock interrogation (which electronically reads all recorded entries through only the main door of the room) was performed by resort security. The results showed no entry through our front door #1406, no entry through door #1407 on our right, and a recorded 2:00pm entry into room #1405 on our left. This entry was determined to be made by a member of the resort maintenance department who entered room #1405 at 2:00pm to work on “lighting”. The balcony design at this resort allows an individual to hop over a waist high railing from one balcony to another between certain groups of rooms. These rooms are all connected by a common balcony and are able to be accessed by hopping over the railing. I was told by management that the security guards watch the balconies for such activities. It seems this is a common problem here. Can you imagine what your neck would feel like looking up at balconies all the time? I observed security guards being nothing more than outdoor pool monitors; socializing, reprimanding kids running in the pool area, opening the gate for guests who did not carry their key card, and watching that no guest leaves their personal belongings at a pool chair for more than 30 minutes while swimming. If you do, they will take your stuff. How can you concentrate on effectively watching balconies when you are doing this other nonsense? My opinion is maybe there’s something more going on behind the scenes here. The D.B.P.D. took fingerprints and DNA samples for the record. I requested a viewing of resort security tapes and was told; no manpower (I volunteered), no time (I offered my time), no cameras on the floors or by the elevators, and the cameras they do have allegedly are not located anywhere to be of value in this situation, unless someone just happens to walk by one of them. Apparently the current security system at this resort is useless when you need it most; it is better suited to protect a thief instead of the guests. My experience with management regarding this incident continues as pathetic and very unprofessional. I felt they were very insensitive to our situation. In the 36 hours after our loss, NO ONE from the resort even had the compassion to check on us. They filled out paperwork as routine and conducted no creditable search for our stolen property. At my request, the adjoining rooms were opened and searched for a possible suspect in hiding. I was later somewhat comforted by the insinuation that their insurance would cover our loss, this turned into A BIG JOKE!! We were nothing but pacified in order to keep everything quiet from the other guests. The shift manager slipped the insurance claim paperwork through our door sometime the next night (Friday), not even the common courtesy to meet with us in a professional manner face to face. I told her she could call me at “any time”, she never did. We checked out on Saturday, September 5, 2009, nothing ever felt so good!!! Upon returning home, I contacted their insurance provider and was assigned an “Adjuster”. After my claim was filed, I got nothing but a runaround. My calls to the adjuster went unanswered and were rarely returned, my emails were not replied to, and questions about my claim were avoided. After the insurance adjuster concluded his investigation, I was told the resort felt they were not liable for our loss and therefore it will not be covered. Well, what is the purpose of insurance? I also spoke with Wyndham Corporate executives who refused to accept liability which would have allowed payment for my loss. My loss is a drop in the bucket compared to what they make through their corporate greed. It seems to me that Wyndham calls the shots for the insurance provider and the guest only gets screwed. We are also supposed to get a refund for our room; I will believe that only if it happens. Even if it does, I am still out almost $2500.00 from a resort who could care less about its guests. In order to possibly locate this camera and track down the thief, I am providing a description of only the stolen items which are identified by a serial number. Please circulate this information in an attempt to locate this stolen equipment. If anyone should identify this equipment, please contact the Daytona Beach Police at 386-671-5100. STOLEN ITEMS: Nikon D90 Digital SLR Camera S/N 3168764; Nikon 18-105mm VR lens S/N 36140518; Nikon 55-200mm VR lens S/N 1263978

Reviews.Title: “Great sopt when considering Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Crash620
Reviews.Content: Nice waterfront 1BR condo at a very reasonable rate if you book early. Within the closed area on the beach so there is no vehicle traffic. Nice central location. Drawback: Security fee for pool towels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: destin101
Reviews.Content: I would definitely go back to the Oceanwalk, Overall the resort is quite nice. All public areas are kept clean The security personnel were all nice. "MOST" of the front desk clerks were quite nice, helpful too. If they would just replace the two 'OLD' double bed mattresses with some new ones. The bedroom is quite large, they could put two queen size beds which would be better yet!! I wish I had taken some pictures of those beds!! You sank in the middle!!! The resort has a nice toddler's area pool, two outdoor pools, hot tubs, indoor pools, Tiki bar, children's activities center, I could go on. It is a family resort, so I guess at times it could be overrun with kids!! We visited the resort the last week in August, kids first week in school down south, so, it was nice, some but not a lot of school age kids. quite a few young families though,with toddlers. I did enjoy the beach and/ or pool areas everyday!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!! Stay Away & Save UR $!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoBParis
Reviews.Content: My husband, children and I were invited to go with a couple of friends and their children on a much needed trip to the beach. We stayed in a nice enough condo and enjoyed the beach daily. My son woke up one morning covered in welts. I assumed, because he has very sensitive skin, that he had a reaction to the sunscreen we were coating him in. A couple of days after we returned home I notice a small brownish-red bug in my daughter's room and didn't really think much about it because it has been a bad summer for bugs in our neck of the woods. After finding another yesterday morning and logging onto the internet to research bugs I discovered that we have BED BUGS!!!! I cannot tell you how upset and disgusted I am! I wish that I had thought to check reviews before going. I cannot believe that this is happening! Please, if you are considering staying here, DON'T! Aside from the uninvited guests, our overall experience was not great! We too waited to get checked in for over an hour. Several nights the fire alarm kept going off only to be met with an announcement to ignore. It was not clean and the people on staff were not friendly! Please stay somewhere else for your own good!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place, can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: waltb87
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall was amazing. The other reviews about the cleanliness is right, the pools aren't the cleanest but just imagine a ton of people getting into the pools from 8am to 12 am, the pools are going to have everything in them, and I completely understand.There was a lazy river, which wasn't that lazy because kids don't understand, but it is ok, I enjoyed it regardless. I liked that there was security almost everywhere which made things safe and under control. There was a poolside bar with food which was great, a indoor bar that opened at 5 pm until about midnight or so, and a little store that sold everything that you may need and also served various foods such as burgers, pizza, sandwiches, etc. The service overall was excellent, the front desk helped us out all the way, and helped us check in pretty early because we switched rooms because of timeshare issues and everything, and it was nothing to do with the hotel. Everything we requested was brought up very promptly and maintenance had to fix our stove, which was fixed in less than 45 minutes. The good amount of pools was excellent, and the hotel also offered things to do for kids, and had a arcade with a decent amount of games, board games for rent, movies for rent (although i would not recommend the movies because they are way overpriced), an "adult" room where guest over the age of 21 could watch tv, surf the net on the hotel's computers or can get on the hotel's WIFI (which is offered in the lobby and a few other places in the hotel, and one of my primary complaints is that WIFI is not offered everywhere throughout the hotel, but it is ok), and play some pool. There was also a fitness center that was very large with free weights, machine weights, and other fitness machines. The hotel also had a direct walkway to the Ocean Walk Shoppes which has Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., Starbucks, Quiznos, and plenty more of other really good shops, and a band shell where various bands perform. Daytona Beach offers the beach for driving access, but luckily the hotel has reserved the stretch of beach in front of their hotel for non-driving access for everything that is not a service vehicle or a vendor (which one was on the beach everyday that offered sandwiches, burgers, hot dogs, ice cream, cold drinks, etc), and the hotel places a security guard at a gate right off the beach monitoring those that go in and out to and from the beach, which i found very good, and there are a few key access points where guests can access the hotel at a lots of different points of entry into the hotel with their room key card. The rooms were very nice, not the cleanest i have ever seen, but definitely manageable. PLEASE READ: ALL THOUGH THE HOTEL OFFERS OCEAN FRONT, OCEANVIEW, AND STREET VIEW ROOMS, THEY ALSO OFFER ROOMS THAT DO NOT HAVE EITHER OF THESE VIEWS, BUT DO VIEW A HALLWAY, which was awkward when we had to move into one of those rooms, but we were hardly in the room anyway. The rooms had nice bathrooms, enough of a kitchen to create a meal, and the room was very cozy overall. I am complaining like the rest of everyone on here, they do not give enough towels in the room. But the hotel does give each guest in the room a large beach towel which is very nice, but when not returned, will cost you $15 each. There were two towers, North and South, the South being the older one and each had a parking deck, where the spots were kind of small. Each tower had elevators that moved very fast, which people were complaining about the waiting times, but there are so many guest at one time, I now know why they take a long time. The hotel had a the bar at night, and also offered different activities throughout the hotel for teens, kids, and adults, things such as hula hoop contest, limbo contest, karaoke, dancing, and more. But those activities may not be offered for too much long, it being the end of the summer. I overall loved the hotel, everything about it, the small little quirks are easily ignorable, and I look forward to going back sometime in the future. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: matts8008
Reviews.Content: We spent the week before school started at the Ocean Walk and had a great time. After reading other reviews I was concerned about the elevator issues but we had very few problems. Check-in and check-out were obviously busy times for the elevators, but regular usage was no problem. The staff was awesome - quick check in at 3:45 on a Saturday. The room was nice and clean with lots of dishes and utensils. The room was very very nice. No parking issues at all - we went out 1-2 times a day and always found a close parking spot on the first level of the parking garage. It appeared to fill up late at night but this was not an issue for us as we were in our room after about 9:00 PM. The pool area was awesome and beach was beautiful. Our son did a few of the activities for kids and enjoyed them. The activities staff was very helpful and nice. In some reviews people complain about the '30-minute chair reserve policy' but we liked it. It's so frustrating to visit a hotel where at 7:00 AM every morning people rush to the pool, throw their towel on a chair, and then claim it for the entire day (even if they don't use it more than a few minutes). This allowed us to find a chair when we needed it. We were disappointed at the lack of a sit-down restaurant on property, but there were a few places to eat within walking distance. The only complains we had were that Daytona itself is kind of a dump - very few nice restaurants, lots of old/run down/closed businesses, but we had a great time at the resort. Also no free Internet access! Free wifi in the lobby, but you're out of luck in your room. It's ridiculous that the redneck hotel down the street has free wifi but the Wyndham can't provide it when you pay $200+ night. We would have gladly paid for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Walk on by the Wyndham Ocean Walk”
Reviews.Author: bucki4life
Reviews.Content: 1. Upon driving 15 hours and checking in, I had to wait for over an hour and a half to catch an elevator from the parking garage to our floor. That was ridiculous. 2. The pool policy of confiscating all our stuff after 30 minutes is horrible. I was swimming with two children and we decided to get out of the pool. We got to our chair only to discover all our stuff was missing. It took me 15 minutes of searching out "security" guards to find out that they threw it all in a trash bag. This is a horrible, horrible policy for a "family" resort. Do you really expect people to just lay out and sunbathe and not get in the pools without constantly running back to security and "checking in" to make sure all their stuff doesn't vanish. It's a damn good thing I didn't have my wallet, cell phone or any valuables with me that day. 3. The utensils in the room were sub-par. We had to make due with a pizza cutter that was broken. The only pot in the room held about 2 cups of water and there were no baking pans at all. I have stayed at many different resorts through time share trades and this one was the worst stocked kitchen I have ever seen and it wasn't even close. 4. The door on the second bedroom of the unit we had wouldn't even close because of swelling or it was improperly hung. 5. The shower in the main bedroom wasn't very clean upon check in. It wasn't filthy, but it also looked like it hadn't be truly cleaned in a few weeks. 6. The pool area was roped off every morning for cleaning. We walked on the beach to see the sunrise one morning and security wouldn't let us walk through the pool area to access the beach. We had to walk through the resort down to the South exit to get to the beach. For a resort that is "on the beach" that is another horrible policy. 7. No fewer than 3 times did the fire alarm go off during the week. I felt like I was a freshman in college again living in a crappy dorm. All in all, we were quite disappointed with our week but made the most of it. Actually the expression "that's Wyndham for you" became sort of a running joke with us as the week progressed. I can not and will not recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back again!”
Reviews.Author: kewldog4
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5 pm on a Sunday and the lobby was packed! However, we quickly got our room in about 10 minutes. I was quite impressed with the size of the resort how quickly we got in our room. The only downside to the resort is parking. There is only 1 parking space per unit even if you are in a 3 or 4 bedroom suite. There was convenient parking garage across the street. The parking garage had a special rate for Wyndham guests. However, it was rather confusing to purchase and use. This resort is 75% timeshared so more than likely you will be asked to attend a timeshare meeting for some gift. The pools, lazy river, and beach were outstanding - by far the best out there! The resort also has beach towels for all of their guests! Internet was found only in the lobby. The rooms were quite spacious with a great view of the ocean and beach. However, not all of the rooms face the ocean. Lastly, my family had a great time doing many of the activities the resort has to offer. Most of them are geared towards children. I will definitely try to get back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience--review has lots of detail”
Reviews.Author: LynK
Reviews.Content: Our stay at OceanWalk was from August 5-8, 2009..3 nights. My husband was attending a conference and we took along our 13 year old daughter and her friend. At previous conferences in Daytona we had stayed at the Hilton (was Adams Mark) next door, but we wanted 2 bedrooms and OceanWalk was a better deal. Just before we left I decided to check TripAdvisor and was dismayed at so many negative comments on OceanWalk. Our experience was positive so I feel compelled to give the negative reviews some balance. I'm going to write this as I go and give a lot of detail because I had so many questions about OW that I wish had been addressed in some of the other reviews. It will be long, but I hope it will be of use to others. First, let me say that I am from Florida and would not choose Daytona as a place to vacation. I think there are other better beaches in Florida and the whole Daytona scene, shops, etc. isn't really my cup of tea. But if you go there and if you stay at OW here's my 2 cents. This resort is huge, and it has many time-share places within it, so the different units may be in different states of repair or comfort, I guess. Our suite was simply excellent. We got a 2 bedroom, 2 bath on the 23rd floor of the North Tower (25 stories high). I was disappointed when my husband said that they didn't have any oceanfront available, but when I saw our place I was very happy. We were put in a corner unit, with a wraparound balcony so the view is of the river and the town to the west and to the south you can see miles of beach and the Atlantic Ocean stretching out. At night the lights are magical and with the 3 sliding glass doors we have a great view from inside to the south and west at the same time. Another unexpected advantage of this location was that we can see the sunset. After looking up at the ones on the beach side I decided that I liked our side better since we had a panoramic view and such a large balcony. The balconies on the ocean side are much smaller. Info on the unit, #2333, cost $199 per night reserved through calling OW, not through a private or timeshare situation. We perhaps could have gotten a better price, but after seeing our unit I thought this was a reasonable price for it. Also, staying in 2 rooms at the Hilton, even with the conference discount, would have been more than this so we were satisfied. Unit seems freshly painted in tropical colors. The furniture is of good quality and the upholstery is not worn at all. Everything is very clean. Drapes and carpet look new. The bedspreads seem a little worn, but not bad. The master bedroom mattress was firm but comfortable. The girls said the same about the double beds. The sheets are of decent quality, not high end, but not thin or scratchy. 3 good pillows on the master bed. There are 3 TVs in the unit, one for each BR and one in the living room. Lots of nice lamps--Master BR has a lamp on each side of the bed, but the room with 2 double beds only has one on the table between the beds. There is an alarm clock in the both bedrooms. There is an iron and full sized ironing board. Master bathroom has a shower and a jacuzzi tub. Very spacious. They give you bar soap and a few little bottles of shampoo, etc. but the shampoo wouldn't last long. There were handtowels, washcloths and 4 bath towels in the master bathroom and 4 in the other bathroom, so not having enough towels was not an issue. Only weird thing in the master bath is that there is only one hook to hang towels...no bars or rings. There is a hair dryer both bathrooms. The living room has a 30" TV, not flat screen or high definition, but fine. There are numerous cable channels, a DVD and VCR player. Also a boom box type thing for music. We did not use this. The dining room has a long table that seats 6 with very sturdy and comfortable chairs. A bonus was that I was able to get an unlocked wireless connection from the living room and the master bedroom. The signal was low inside, but on the balcony the signal was usually great. There is a computer room in OW and I saw people using laptops sitting in the comfortable chairs in the lobby, so even if you didn't luck into this free wireless you can access it elsewhere. The kitchen is large and equipped with all the basic stuff. Because I was concerned about what to bring I will give some detail here about what was in our kitchen: Counter appliances were--Toaster, Blender, Coffeemaker (no filters provided). There is a large microwave above the electric stove, which is full sized and has a full sized oven. The fridge is medium sized, has a ice maker--I think this was turned off when we arrived, but I fooled around with the button and it works fine. They have a couple of cutting boards, full set of forks, spoons, knives, plus steak knives and some long knives. Probably would be a good idea to bring a good quality knife or two if you plan to cook. There is a large pot (size you would boil water for spaghetti), plus a small pan and a fry pan. These pans are of good quality. Provided are plates, bowls, cups, glasses, wine glasses. Also, colander, paper towel roll, measuring cups, grater, large serving/mixing spoons, spatula, can opener and corkscrew. There are several mixing bowls. No potholders. No plastic ware for using as foodsavers, except for one medium sized plastic bowl that has a top; no plastic wrap or foil. There is a dishwasher and a starter supply of DW detergent in little packs. There is a garbage disposal. The trash can has a plastic bag in it and there is a spare hung on the side of the trash can and a few more under the sink. There is no drain rack to put your dishes in if you hand wash them. There are several dishrags supplied and a new scrubbie (no sponge) and a couple of dish towels. No liquid dish soap is provided. Bottom line--we didn't do a lot of cooking, but I wish I had brought a good cutting knife, a few plastic containers and a small bottle of liquid dishsoap. Stacked washer and dryer are in a closet. They give you a few starter packages of detergent, but you should consider bringing your own bottle if you think you will be doing laundry. The washer and dryer are small so can't do very big loads and the dryer is loud, but this wasn't that big of a problem to me. Resort activities and comments on the general place: Others complained about how crowded everything was, problems with elevators, etc. No complaints from us. Our stay in August is definitely low season so that should be factored in. We had no problems checking in, no problems with the elevators. There are only 4, but they came reasonably quickly and though you did have to stop at a lot of floors sometimes, anyone who has ever ridden elevators in tall buildings just accepts this. The people staying here are not the dregs of society as depicted by one reviewer. There are lots of normal middle class families, lots of happy sunburned kids; a variety of people, but perfectly nice to associate with! After touring around the place with the girls I felt fine to let them go off on their own as long as they stayed together. Kids are allowed at the pool without adult supervision if they are older than 12. There are lots of security officers wandering around wearing gray uniforms. Game room for kids has arcade games; give them a lot of quarters if they are going to spend any time here. There is a small pool table in there, too. There is also a game room for adults next door with 2 pool tables, cost $1 per game. There are 3 computers in the adult game room. The computer room is next to these and they have a few more computers that you can sign up to use. I saw people in there with laptops. The indoor mini golf isn't much but could be something to do on a rainy day and it doesn't cost anything to play. It is in a big room on the 4th floor. There are 4 different outside pool areas and you are supposed to wear your wristband in this area. At 10:30 am all the chairs at all the pools were taken but later in the afternoon, around 3 pm there were free chairs. The pool area did always seem kind of crowded. We preferred hanging out at the beach so we didn't make use of the pools. There is a kiddie pool which is shallow and has a fence around it and has little things to climb on, etc. This is a small area, but would be nice if you had a toddler. There is the "lazy river" pool which doesn't seem like much to me..you sit in a tube and go around an island. There were always people in it, though. You have to use their tubes which I guess could be hard to get sometimes, but there were several sitting on the side at 10:30 am. I saw a group of girls participating in a hula hoop contest with some resort personnel. Another pool has a volleyball net set up and the 4th pool is big and has a decent sized slide that corkscrews around, which seems like fun for kids. There is access to the beach from the pool area and this is monitored by a resort guy who isn't supposed to let you back in that gate unless you have the wristband, but I never saw him stop anyone and I came and went without a wristband many times. You can get beach towels from the resort for your stay, and if you don't turn it back in at the end they charge you $15 per towel. We were allotted 8 towels over our 3 night stay that we could get at any time, so one day we got 3 and could get the other ones whenever. There are 2 indoor pools, one in the North and one in the South Tower. The one in the North Tower is BY FAR the nicer one, so if you are staying in the South Tower & want to use an indoor pool go over to the North Tower one. The gym has 4 new treadmills and good looking bikes and at least one elliptical. Otherwise the equipment and machines are old and the place isn't that nice. The free weights didn't include light weights that women typically use (3 lb and 5 lb) that I could see; there are towels available there. I used the treadmill and a couple of the machines, but didn't enjoy the workout much. There is nowhere to be on the floor to do situps, etc. All felt kind of grungy. Make use of the concierge if you want to do any activities in the area. Our girls wanted to go to the Daytona Lagoon waterpark which is across the street. The cost is $20 for people over 4 ft. tall if you buy your ticket from the hotel concierge, and $29 if you buy at the waterpark. People under 4 ft. tall cost $17 at the hotel. The girls had fun and they went by themselves and spent about 3 hours there. They stamp your hand so you can re-enter but when my daughter used soap to wash her hands the stamp came off. They didn't want to go back anyway but that might have been a problem. Restaurant comments-General Daytona Beach area--we didn't eat at any restaurant in the OW resort: Pantheon Pizza for great pizza, very good price. We got a large 16 in. 3 topping plus a small greek salad (salad wasn't too good) and one imported bottled beer and the check was $20 not including tip. We took pizza home. Also people at the next table over had hamburgers and my husband said, " I don't eat hamburgers, but if I did I'd come here." Very, very casual. No ambience, wear whatever you have on. You have to drive over the bridge to get to it, but drive is only about 15 min. Edamame Japanese Restaurant--just happened on this place after we bailed out on Bubba Gumps because it was so crowded and chaotic and the wait time was too long. We drove over the bridge looking for some local place and found this place in a strip shopping center near Outback. We had the hibachi meals and it was great fun to watch the cooking performance and great food. They also serve sushi, regular Japanese food, etc. Beer and wine very reasonable prices. Huge portions. Everyone took home leftovers. The hibachi meals come with soup, salad, shrimp appetizer, fried rice, noodles, whatever meat you choose. There was a veggie option that only cost $10.95 for all of it. Very fresh vegetables and delicious. We loved the people in this place too. Friendly and attentive. Nice decor, but not fancy. Bubba Gumps--right next to the OW so easy walk. We peeked in and checked it out midday and thought it looked like fun. Looks like a good place to take kids, but when dinner time came it was mobbed. I would give it a try another time, but earlier in the day. The Cellar--Italian restaurant just over the bridge and a little south of Int'l Speedway Blvd. Has an extensive wine list. Excellent italian food, the homemade pasta was the best thing we got. My husband got the snapper special which wasn't all that special, but the girls got the "alla checca" rigatoni with sauce and it was exceptional. I got seafood risotto. Two fabulous desserts to share. Would recommend this place for a special night out, a little expensive compared to other places we ate, but the food was really good. The concierge can make reservations for you. Bottom line on our stay--OceanWalk is a family oriented place and don't expect otherwise. I'm sure that at times it is more crowded and that would likely make it less appealing, but our August stay was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Brooked30
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son (4) and extended family got back Monday from a week stay at the Ocean Walk. I have to tell you that this resort impressed me very much. I have traveled widely, and had little to no complaints with this resort. There were ten of us in a 3 bedroom timeshare. We had a washer and dryer, as well as a full kitchen. While it is true that there were not many towels, doing laundry was no trouble at all. You could start it in the morning when you got up, throw stuff in the dryer, and have it be done when you got back from the beach. The pools were great, and the beach was lovely. We brought our own beach towels from home, and bought a cheap umbrella for 20 bucks. The food poolside was a tad expensive (9 bucks for a burger and fries) but hey, thats hotel food for you. I really enjoyed the activites the hotel had during our stay. We went to karaoke 3 times, water aerobics 2x, and hip hop aerobics! They also had a pirate and princess party that my 5 yr old niece enjoyed, and a hoola hoop contest my 9 yr old niece competed in. My son has autism and had a great time with the pools and the ocean, which was a great relief to us. Our hotel room never felt crowded. I do agree that the elevator situation is a complete joke. We stayed in the North Tower, which had 25 floors. One bank of elevators (4 total) is not nearly enough. I also don't understand why there isn't hotel wide wi-fi. However, even with those things considered, we had a fabulous time. The room was beautiful, the pool was great, and the beach was just gorgeous. I would go again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room; Overcharged $560; Do not trust Daytona Ocean Rentals or Wyndham Ocean Walk”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1212
Reviews.Content: As an avid traveler who has had wonderful and not-so-wonderful hotel experiences, I am imploring you NOT to stay at the Wyndham Ocean Walk! I rented a one-bedroom condo at the Ocean Walk from Daytona Ocean Rentals (DBA Cindy Grutza). The room was filthy! The bed linens were stained (both the set of linens on the bed and the back-up set) and the blanket had cigarette burns in it, even though the room was supposed to be non-smoking. The night stand and kitchen table both had sticky soda stains all over their surfaces. And the last renter's toiletries were still in the bathroom (someone's used razors, dirty hair brush. old Ziploc bags and tampon wrappers are not my idea of cleanliness). It was a complete nightmare. To top it all off, the view from the balcony had been deliberately misrepresented. It looks as though Daytona Ocean Rentals took a picture of the view from a few floors above this condo and cropped the photo so you don't realize until you arrive that your view is 100% obstructed. Yes -- the entire hotel is between your room and the ocean. And with wall-to-wall windows along each internal hallway, all 20-something floors can see you while you try to relax on your balcony. I work in marketing; I know exactly how and why the picture was cropped like it was. To make matters even worse, Daytona Ocean Rentals overcharged me $560! They promised to refund the unused portion of our stay because of these problems (which is the only reason we checked out early; otherwise we would have purchased our own sheets and stuck it out). But when I got home from vacation later in the week, I received a handwritten note (oh yeah, she's that professional) saying she had changed her mind and would not be refunding our money. I have never in my entire life had a hotel or a merchant rip me off. It is the most frustrating experience I have ever had and I would never want another person to have to endure this. In an economy like this where people are struggling, I find it disgusting that there are hotels and rental companies who are trying to take advantage of people to make an extra buck. Please don't let this happen to you. Stay at the Hampton Inn; RUN from the Ocean Walk and Daytona Ocean Rentals!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: kjhamh
Reviews.Content: Very, very disappointed. Room was not what was advertised second bedroom was not a kings size bed instead two doubles (two adults could not sleep on) Aside from the disarray of the room. For instance: holes in the doors, wallpaper falling of the walls, a noisy dyer, washing machine did not work. Called for blanket and pillows all three days, never received pillows even after complaining at the front desk. We didn't want extra there were not provided for the pull out couch ! Outside on pool deck security always present but we still have a camera and a bag stolen in broad daylight. This probably happened because of the lack of appropriate wrist bands for the pool (they ran out for several days) So anyone could come onto the pool deck from the beach and security let them in. We were told that four bags were stolen that day and that security was not owned by the hotel they were contracted to an outside company.The pool was cloudy,sandy,salty and many times a hairball(serious) and other stuff would float by. There was little difference between the pool and the ocean.WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, clean, & comfortable, but resort could be improved”
Reviews.Author: jarscr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Ocean Walk during mid-May and had a pleasant stay. It was our first visit here. The resort is comfortable and clean and we found several things to like about it. There is a nice bar and restaurant inside of the resort. Additionally, there is a shopping, restaurant, and move theater complex (Ocean Walk Shoppes) next door to the resort where there are several great places to eat, including Cold Stone Creamery and Johnny Rockets. You are able to get to the Ocean Walk Shoppes directly from the resort; there is a connecting hallway which we found very convenient. We found the resort staff friendly and helpful. Halfway through our stay our room key card stopped working and the staff apologized and immediately replaced it. The staff was also very helpful in answering any questions we had. We felt very safe at the resort, too. Your room key is required to get into the parking lot and pool area (if you are coming from outside). I noticed there were always several security guards at the resort at all times, including one at the front entrance and one in the back pool area. There is a gift store, small convenience store/grocery store, adult lounge (consisting of a pool table and a few computers), computer room, arcade, kid’s craft area, and miniature golf area in the resort. The resort is within walking distance of many eateries and gift shops and within driving distance of several pharmacies and grocery stores, including Publix, Winn-Dixie, and Walgreens. There is a gate the leads from the pool area to the ocean, which is also very convenient. The resort appears to be kept up well. The outer appearance is very nice and looks much better than many of the other hotels in the area. The unit we stayed in was very clean and all of the furniture was comfortable. There was a washer and dryer in the unit, which was very convenient. I would suggest bringing your own laundry detergent or buying it somewhere other than the resort, though. You are given a small amount of laundry detergent initially, but even with just my husband and I, we quickly went through this. The laundry detergent sold at the resort was overpriced. As much as we enjoyed our stay, there were a few things we were not entirely happy with. Using the internet is very difficult at the resort. The wi-fi signal is only in the lobby area and the signal was very weak, though we tried moving to several different spots in the lobby.
